title.value: Взаимодействие с почвой многоколесных ходовых систем
Interaction between soil and multiwheel drive system
Interaction between soil and multiwheel drive system

subject.value: mata©riel de mise en valeur du sol

journal.title: Agropanorama : scientific and technical journal for the agro-industrial complex workers

person.name: Chechetkin, A.D., Belarus State Agrarian Technical Univ., Minsk (Belarus)

abstract.value: Intensification of agriculture, increase of its productivity, decline of labor resources leads to an increase of the mass of agricultural equipment enlarging the amount of wheel running on one track. Tractor units for distribution of organic and mineral fertilizers are constructed in such a manner that one trail passes 4-5 wheels. As part of the tractor train wheels of one side can be increased to seven. The wheels are of different sizes, have various configuration profiles of tires and possess different air pressure in the tires. The purpose of the research presented in the article is to consider the interaction of a pneumatic tire with the ground while rolling on the trail with consideration of distribution of normal wheel loads, the configuration profile of tires, sizes and rigidity of tires and taking into account the difference in deformation of tire on the ground and a rigid base. The mathematical model of the interaction of multiple wheel running systems with soil is created. Each wheel is considered to be based on the individual parameters. The offset traces of different wheels are taken into account. The model is based on the representation of a contact surface of the tire and the soil.
